title: National Day of Remembrance of the 80th Anniversary of the Liberation of Auschwitz, 2025
summary: The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, declaring January 27, 2025, as the National Day of Remembrance for the 80th Anniversary of the Liberation of Auschwitz. It reflects on the atrocities committed at Auschwitz, where over one million victims, primarily Jews, were murdered during the Holocaust. The proclamation emphasizes mourning for the lost lives and honors the courage of survivors, while reaffirming the commitment to combat anti-Semitism and educate future generations about the Holocaust. It calls on all Americans to observe this day with commemorative activities and highlights the importance of dignity and respect for all individuals. The proclamation underscores the enduring impact of the Holocaust on history and the necessity of remembering these events to prevent future atrocities.
